message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: while(itr1.hasNext() && itr2.hasNext()) {
  String str1 = itr1.next();
  String str2 = itr2.next();
  int compareResult = str1.compareTo(str2);
  if(compareResult < 0) {
    L3.add(str1);
    L3.add(str2);
  } else if(compareResult > 0) {
    L3.add(str2);
    L3.add(str1);
  } else {
    L3.add(str1);
    L3.add(str2);
  }
}
while(itr1.hasNext()) {
  L3.add(itr1.next());
}
while(itr2.hasNext()) {
  L3.add(itr2.next());
}
<<<explanation>>>: In the while loop, you can compare the current elements from both iterators using the compareTo() method. If the result is less than 0, add the element from itr1 and itr2 to L3. If the result is greater than 0, add the element from itr2 and itr1 to L3. If the result is 0, add both elements to L3. After the while loop, if there are any remaining elements in itr1 or itr2, add them to L3.
